quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Meaning and Russia
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the meaning of the names Ann, Anna or Anne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gracious

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Greek name Stephen, or Steven?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crown

questions.question: What do Tsaritsyn and Volgograd have in common?

options.text: Cities of this name are found in both Russia and Kazakhstan.
They both lie on the shores of Lake Ladoga.
Both have asteroids named after them.
These are names for the same city at different times in its history.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: These are names for the same city at different times in its history.

questions.question: Winston Churchill was Prime Minister of Great Britain during World War II.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What do Dan Aykroyd and Joseph Stalin have in common?

options.text: Both are said to have/had syndactyly - i.e. webbed toes.
Both have/had heterochromia - i.e. with eyes of different colour (one brown and one green eye each).
Both studied for the priesthood but were expelled from their seminary.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both are said to have/had syndactyly - i.e. webbed toes.

questions.question: What do Albert Camus and Vladimir Nabokov have in common?

options.text: Both were (football) goalkeepers in their youth.
Both won the Nobel Prize for Literature.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both were (football) goalkeepers in their youth.

questions.question: What do Drew Barrymore and Gywneth Paltrow have in common?

options.text: They have a grandfather in common.
They both were briefly married to Canadian comics.
They both have children whose names are fruits.
They both have Stephen Spielberg as a godfather.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They both have Stephen Spielberg as a godfather.

questions.question: What does the biblical name Satan mean in Hebrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Accuser

questions.question: What do the Turkish towns of Bodrum and Efes have in common?

options.text: These twin towns stand opposite each other at the Black Sea end of the Bosphorus channel.
Both towns were completely destroyed by the 1999 Kocaeli earthquake.
They are the sites of two of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
The site of ancient Troy is flanked by these two towns.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are the sites of two of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

questions.question: What do Liechtenstein and Uzbekistan have in common?

options.text: They do not print their own currency but use a more powerful neighbours currency.
They are sandwiched between two countries.
The national sport of both is falconry.
They are doubly landlocked - they are surrounded by countries with no seashore.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are doubly landlocked - they are surrounded by countries with no seashore.

questions.question: What do Azerbaijan and Russia have in common?

options.text: They have an enclave (a part of another nations territory completely surrounded by their own territory).
They have a coastline on the Black Sea.
They have an exclave that is an enclave of another country.
They have an exclave (a part of their territory that is separated from the main territory) that is not an enclave of another country.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have an exclave (a part of their territory that is separated from the main territory) that is not an enclave of another country.

questions.question: What do Kaiser Wilhelm II of Prussia, Tsar Nicholas II of Russia and King George V of England have in common?

options.text: Kaiser Wilhelm was first cousin to both George V and Tsar Nicholas.
They were all grandchildren of Queen Victoria.
George V was first cousin to both Kaiser Wilhelm and Tsar Nicholas.
Tsar Nicholas was first cousin to both Kaiser Wilhelm and George V.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George V was first cousin to both Kaiser Wilhelm and Tsar Nicholas.

questions.question: What do Art Garfunkel, Tom Lehrer and Ted Kaczynski (the Unabomber) have in common?

options.text: They all gained degrees in mathematics.
They were all accredited adult volunteers in the Boy Scouts of America.
They were all undergraduates at Harvard.
They were all charged with either slander or libel.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They all gained degrees in mathematics.

questions.question: What do Ankara, Canberra and Ottawa have in common?

options.text: They are national capitals which are not the largest cities in their country.
They were new cities created expressly to be the capital of their countries.
They are national capital cities which are not situated on rivers.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are national capitals which are not the largest cities in their country.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the biblical name Andrew, which has a Greek origin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Masculine

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Author and Following
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, fiction, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following was a leading British engineer and architect of the 19th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isambard Kingdom Brunel

questions.question: Which of the following statements about Charles Darwin is true?

options.text: He is the author of the evolution theory.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Isaac Newton described universal gravitation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This author fictionalized notorious and sensational murders of famous people, most notably the OJ Simpson case.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dominick Dunne

questions.question: Which of the following does Katherine Kurtz write about?

options.text: A magical race of people called the Deryni

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which American author chose the deep south for her subject matter and wrote only one published book in her lifetime?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of these

questions.question: Which of the following works was written by William Shakespeare?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: On 8 December 1980 he was shot in New York City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: Oliver Cromwell overthrew the English monarchy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What does author Charlaine Harris write about?

options.text: Vampires, were-people, fairies and other paranormal creatures

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vampires, were-people, fairies and other paranormal creatures

questions.question: Princess Diana supported the international campaign to ban landmines.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: While best known as the author of The Godfather, Mario Puzo also wrote a novelization about which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Borgia family

questions.question: This author of military and detective fiction has written a popular series about the US Marine Corps, the Philadelphia Police Dept., and a WWII series, set mainly in Argentina.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W.E.B. Griffin

questions.question: He was a naval commander who led the British forces to victory during the Napoleonic Wars.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horatio Nelson

questions.question: Who inherited the throne after the death of her half-sister Mary I Tudor, known as Bloody Mary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth of England

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Series and Marie Antoinette
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the profession of a famous fictional character created by Kathy Reichs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a forensic anthropologist

questions.question: This author is known for the series about detective Dave Robicheaux.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Lee Burke

questions.question: Marie Antoinette and her husband, the Dauphin of France, consummated their marriage on the wedding night.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Marie Antoinette was tried by the Revolutionary Tribunal on 14 October 1793. What was she accused of?

options.text: sending millions of livres of treasury money to Austria
plotting to kill the Duke of Orléans

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these authors writes about agents of the National Underwater and Marine Agency?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clive Cussler

questions.question: Harlan Coben has written a series of books featuring Myron Bolitar. What is Bolitars profession?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sports Agent

questions.question: This author has written sweeping historical sagas about various locales including Hawaii, Alaska, Poland, Texas, the South Pacific and the Caribbean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Michener

questions.question: While Patricia Cornwall is known primarily for her series featuring medical examiner Kay Scarpetta, she also wrote a biography of this person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruth Graham

questions.question: Which statement regarding Marie Antoinettes marriage is true?

options.text: She was officially handed over to her French bearers on an island on the Rhine River.
She was 15 when she married Louis XVI.
During the marriage negotiations, the French lamented the crookedness of her teeth.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Michael Connelly has authored a series of police procedurals featuring this detective.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hieronymous Bosch

questions.question: Name the sociopathic vigilante who is the protagonist of Jeff Lindsays series of novels.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dexter Morgan

questions.question: When did Marie Antoinette marry the Dauphin of France?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1770

questions.question: Maria Antoinette had a simple and careless childhood in the Hofburg.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What character is featured in John Sanford third series of novels, which includes The Fools Run and The Empress File?

options.text: an internal affairs captain enforcing the law
a psychic who assists the FBI
a computer whiz operating somewhat outside the law

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a computer whiz operating somewhat outside the law

questions.question: Marie Antoinette was married to Louis XVI of France.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Marie Antoinette and Author
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, controversy. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these musicals was NOT composed by multiple award-winning English composer Andrew Lloyd Webber?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grease

questions.question: The SI unit of capacitance is named after this English scientist who discovered electromagnetic induction, diamagnetism and electrolysis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Faraday

questions.question: Marie Antoinette gave birth to four children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who directed the 1978 movie Midnight Express, which tells the harrowing story of an American college student visiting Turkey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan Parker

questions.question: Where was Marie Antoinette placed house arrest after the French Revolution broke out?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tuileries Palace

questions.question: This popular character, created by English author Daniel Defoe, has a companion named Friday.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robinson Crusoe

questions.question: These presidents coupled up to discuss their former secretarial jobs. Which pair doesnt fit with the others?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams  John Tyler

questions.question: This major figure in the music industry became popular in the US when his 1975 hit Fame reached number 1 on the Billboard Hot 100.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: This English actor, who rose to stardom after appearing in the film Four Weddings and a Funeral, has repeatedly claimed that acting is not a true calling but just a job he fell into.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hugh Grant

questions.question: Name the author of of the novels Mrs Dalloway and To the Lighthouse, who was a prominent figure in London literary society and a member of the Bloomsbury Group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia Woolf

questions.question: What famous English author named one of his famous fun-loving characters after his son Christopher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A. A. Milne

questions.question: Marie Antoinette spent a lot money on gambling.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What did Maria Teresa do to save the marriage of her daughter, Marie Antoinette?

options.text: She sent her son, Emperor Joseph, to talk to Louis and Marie Antoinette.
She gave her the Petit Trianon as a present.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She sent her son, Emperor Joseph, to talk to Louis and Marie Antoinette.

questions.question: In 2007, this English fashion designer sparked controversy when she created a silver necklace featuring a single leg. The necklace was an apparent attack on her fathers estranged wife Heather Mills, an amputee.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stella McCartney

questions.question: This English singer-songwriter recorded the songs Rolling in the Deep and Someone Like You for her second studio album 21.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adele

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Pair and Policy
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, legacy, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: They certainly were a knowledgeable bunch on foreign affairs except one pair. Which two could not draw on much worldly experience?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison  Andrew Jackson

questions.question: Birthdays were discussed amid laughter and merriment. Which two were not on the same page?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan  Barack Obama

questions.question: Talks about wives saddened all but two of these. Which pair did not seem melancholy at all?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calvin Coolidge  Ronald Reagan

questions.question: Three pairs totally agreed on policy. Which pair was constantly bickering?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams  James Madison

questions.question: As far as inaugurations are concerned, which pair does not belong with the others?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington  John Tyler

questions.question: As far as vice presidents are concerned, some were fortunate, some not. Which pair is different from the other three?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleveland  Rutherford B. Hayes

questions.question: A discussion ensued about jobs and work before their election to the presidency. Which couple didnt understand each other?

options.text: William H. Harrison  Dwight D. Eisenhower
Warren G. Harding  Harry S. Truman
George H.W. Bush,  George W. Bush

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbert Hoover  Theodore Roosevelt

questions.question: Everyone was discussing their time in Congress. Which two could not agree on the benefits of certain policies in reference to their individual states?

options.text: John Quincy Adams  John F. Kennedy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Pierce  Martin Van Buren

questions.question: They all discussed the pros and cons of running a state but one pair was not so current in their views. Which pair seemed too far removed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calvin Coolidge  Theodore Roosevelt

questions.question: Legislative discussion took place but which two were not in the same boat when discussing policy?

options.text: James A. Garfield  Rutherford B. Hayes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerald Ford  Millard Fillmore

questions.question: This New Yorker is best known for his short stories The Legend of Sleepy Hollow and Rip Van Winkle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington Irving

questions.question: Talking about vice presidents, one pair was at odds and evens with the others. Which pair doesnt fit?

options.text: Martin Van Buren  James K. Polk

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison  Andrew Jackson

questions.question: They all were concerned with their legacy of learning. What two were sorely disappointed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Jackson  James K. Polk

questions.question: They now began talking about their early childhoods. Which pair couldnt seem to understand references made by each other?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zachary Taylor  Chester A. Arthur

questions.question: Discussing their memoirs, one pair found that writing them would not have been as easy if they followed the method of the other three pairs. Which pair would that be?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbert Hoover  Harry Truman

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Comedian and Author
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, figures. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This American author, noted for his complex novels, wrote Gravitys Rainbow and The Crying of Lot 49.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Pynchon

questions.question: What comedian said, Outside of a dog, a book is a mans best friend. Inside of a dog its too dark to read.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Groucho Marx

questions.question: This author, who was born and raised in New York City, is best known for her first novel Fear of Flying.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Erica Jong

questions.question: What comedian said, Sometimes I think war is Gods way of teaching us geography.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Rodriguez

questions.question: What is the subtitle of Herman Melvilles popular novel Moby-Dick, which tells the story of a wandering sailor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Whale

questions.question: Who penned the epic Cold War history Underworld and the 2007 novel Falling Man, which focuses on the 9/11 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don DeLillo

questions.question: This poet and essayist, often called the father of free verse, penned the poetry collection Leaves of Grass, which was initially described as obscene for its overt sexuality.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walt Whitman

questions.question: What comedian uttered the following words, I think if I took therapy, the doctor would quit. Hed just pick up the couch and walk out of the room.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Rickles

questions.question: This novelist depicted the fictional characters Doctor Daneeka, Snowden, Milo Minderbinder, who are stationed on an island off the coast of Italy during World War II.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Heller

questions.question: This author, raised in Brooklyn, New York, wrote The Naked and the Dead.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norman Mailer

questions.question: What American novelist, short story writer, and designer won the Pulitzer Prize for the 1920 novel The Age of Innocence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edith Wharton

questions.question: What comedian said, I couldnt wait for success, so I went ahead without it.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jonathan Winters

questions.question: One of the key figures of 19th-century literary realism, he was the author of The Ambassadors and The Portrait of a Lady.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry James

questions.question: What comedian made the following statement: All men make mistakes, but married men find out about them sooner.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Skelton

questions.question: What famous comedian said, You know youre getting old when you get that one candle on the cake. Its like, See if you can blow this out.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Seinfeld
